writex.header: Publish on Writex.io, share a link to the Reader

readers.paidSubscribersHint: Readers who paid for this book

writex.description: You're publishing your work for free. Choose the audience on the left and publish content for them on the right. The marketplace isn't available yet, so make sure to promote your work by sharing the reader link on social media.
writex.descriptionPaid: You can also publish it for a fee.

biases.header: The Perils of Plagiarizing AI-Generated Content
biases.text:
In the age of AI-driven content creation, it is important to be aware of the ethical boundaries when using AI-generated text. Using AI-generated prompts as your own content without proper attribution is a form of plagiarism and can have serious consequences.

Firstly, passing off AI-generated text as your own work undermines your credibility as a writer or content creator. Authenticity is highly valued, and building trust with your audience is crucial for success. By using AI-generated text without proper credit, you jeopardize your reputation and risk losing the trust of your audience.

Secondly, AI-generated content may not always be accurate or reliable. AI models, such as GPT-4, are trained on vast amounts of data from the internet, which can contain outdated, biased, or incorrect information. By using AI-generated text without proper vetting or fact-checking, you risk perpetuating inaccuracies and spreading misinformation.

Lastly, using AI-generated content without attribution can result in legal consequences. As AI-generated content becomes more prevalent, copyright and intellectual property laws are adapting to encompass these new technologies. Failing to properly attribute the source of AI-generated text could lead to potential lawsuits or other legal ramifications.

In conclusion, while AI-generated content can be an invaluable tool for writers and content creators, it is crucial to use it responsibly and ethically. Always attribute the source of AI-generated text, fact-check the information, and remember to maintain your own unique voice and perspective.

sell.description: You can set a price for each chapter. We recommend keeping the first 2-3 chapters free, allowing readers to sample your book before making a purchase.
sell.error: Щось пішло не так. Будь ласка, спробуйте пізніше.
sell.descriptionCreatePaymentAccount: We'll create your account on our payment provider, Stripe, and you'll be able to receive payments from your readers.
sell.descriptionFinishOnboarding: We'll finish onboarding you to Stripe, our payment provider, and you'll be able to receive payments from your readers.

onboardingFinished.text: You've finished onboarding to Stripe, our payment provider. You can now receive payments from your readers.

dashboard.text: View an overview of your sales by accessing your Stripe dashboard.

promotion.text: You can use the link below to share your book on social media or send it to your readers.

sell.tabSellBookHint: You have the option to set a price for each chapter. We suggest offering the first 2-3 chapters for free, allowing readers to get a taste of your book before deciding to make a purchase.
sell.tabsSellChaptersHint: In this section, you can set the price for the entire book, including both the current and future chapters. It doesn't matter how large your book is, if a reader pays the price you've set, they will have access to all future chapters that you publish.

disabled.publicAccess: You are unable to set a price for this chapter as it is publicly available.
disabled.unknown: You are unable to set a price for this chapter as it is not available.

admin.title: Edit title information
admin.titleDescription: This information will be displayed on the publisher's page. Try to get essence of their work in a few sentences.
admin.contactsDescription: This information will be displayed on the publisher's page. You can add links to their social media, website, or email.
admin.acceptanceDescription: The declared acceptance should be taken from publisher website. The average acceptance time is calculated based on the last 10 submissions. If you don't have enough submissions, you can declare the acceptance time.
admin.criteriaDescription: These criteria will be displayed on the publisher's page. You can add or remove criteria.
